item.title: Becky add a quote by E. Lockhart
item.description: "She will not be simple and sweet. She will not be what people tell her she should be." -- E. Lockhart

item.title: Becky add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Books are the ultimate Dumpees: put them down and they’ll wait for you forever; pay attention to them and they always love you back." -- John Green

item.title: Becky add a quote by John Green
item.description: "I'm not saying that everything is survivable. Just that everything except the last thing is." -- John Green

item.title: Becky add a quote by John Green
item.description: "What is the point of being alive if you don't at least try to do something remarkable?" -- John Green

item.title: Becky add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Those of us who frequent the band room have long suspected that Becca maintains her lovely figure by eating nothing but the souls of kittens and the dreams of impoverished children." -- John Green

item.title: Becky add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Remember that time in the minivan, twenty minutes ago, when we didn't die?" -- John Green

item.title: Becky add a quote by E. Lockhart
item.description: "Secrets are more powerful when people know you've got them." -- E. Lockhart

item.title: Becky add a quote by Maureen Johnson
item.description: "The funny thing about stop signs is that they're also start signs." -- Maureen Johnson

item.title: Becky add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "My rapier wit hides my inner pain." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Becky add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "I don't want to be a man," said Jace. "I want to be an angst-ridden teenager who can't confront his own inner demons and takes it out verbally on other people instead." "Well," said Luke, "you're doing a fantastic job." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Becky add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "I am a man" he told her, "and men do not consume pink beverages. Get thee gone woman, and bring me something brown." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Becky add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Sarcasm is the last refuge of the imaginatively bankrupt." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Becky add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You don’t forget the face of the person who was your last hope." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Becky add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "So it's you and a syringe against the Capitol? See, this is why no one lets you make the plans." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Becky add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Happy Hunger Games! And may the odds be ever in your favor." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Becky add a quote by Cory Doctorow
item.description: "When in trouble or in doubt, run in circles, scream and shout." -- Cory Doctorow

item.title: Becky add a quote by Cory Doctorow
item.description: "Never underestimate the determination of a kid who is time-rich and cash-poor." -- Cory Doctorow

item.title: Becky add a quote by Cory Doctorow
item.description: "I can't go underground for a year, ten years, my whole life, waiting for freedom to be handed to me. Freedom is something you have to take for yourself." -- Cory Doctorow

item.title: Becky add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "You know you've reached a new plateau of group mediocrity when even a Canadian is alarmed by your lack of individuality." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Becky add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Except for the people who were there that one day they discovered the polio vaccine, being part of history is rarely a good idea. History is one war after another with a bunch of murders and natural disasters in between." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Becky add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Becky add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Governments and fashions come and go but Jane Eyre is for all time." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Becky add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "After all, reading is arguably a far more creative and imaginative process than writing; when the reader creates emotion in their head, or the colors of the sky during the setting sun, or the smell of a warm summer's breeze on their face, they should reserve as much praise for themselves as they do for the writer - perhaps more." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Becky add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Becky add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "History has rewritten itself so many times I'm not really sure how it was to begin with -- it's a bit like trying to guess the original color of a wall when it's been repainted eight times." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Becky add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "I didn't set out to discover a truth. I was actually sent to the Outer Fringes to conduct a chair census and learn some humility. But the truth inevitably found me, as important truths often do, like a lost thought in need of a mind." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Becky add a quote by Scott Westerfeld
item.description: "Sometimes the facts in my head get bored and decide to take a walk in my mouth. Frequently this is a bad thing." -- Scott Westerfeld

item.title: Becky add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Talking to a drunk person was like talking to an extremely happy, severely brain-damaged three-year-old." -- John Green

item.title: Becky add a quote by John Green
item.description: "What a treacherous thing to believe that a person is more than a person." -- John Green

item.title: Becky add a quote by Scott Westerfeld
item.description: "What you do, the way you think, makes you beautiful." -- Scott Westerfeld
